sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the world, located in Central Asia. It is known for its vast steppes, natural resources, and blend of nomadic traditions with modern development.

sections.title: Capital City
sections.content: Astana is the capital city of Kazakhstan. It is known for its modern architecture and rapid development.

sections.title: Currency
sections.content: The official currency of Kazakhstan is the Kazakhstani tenge (KZT).

sections.title: Language
sections.content: The official language is Kazakh, while Russian is widely used in government, business, and daily communication.

sections.title: Traditional Food
sections.content: Kazakh cuisine is influenced by nomadic traditions, with popular dishes such as beshbarmak, kazy, and baursak.

sections.title: Geography
sections.content: Kazakhstan has vast grasslands, deserts, mountains, and lakes. It borders the Caspian Sea and has rich mineral and energy resources.

sections.title: Culture
sections.content: Kazakh culture emphasizes hospitality, respect for elders, and traditions rooted in nomadic heritage, including music, horse riding, and oral storytelling.

sections.title: Tourism
sections.content: Tourist attractions include the Altai Mountains, Charyn Canyon, Big Almaty Lake, and the modern cityscape of Astana.

sections.title: Fun Fact
sections.content: Kazakhstan was the launch site of the world’s first human spaceflight, with Yuri Gagarin launching from Baikonur Cosmodrome.

history.event: Nomadic tribes inhabited the Central Asian steppes, forming early cultural foundations.
The region became part of the Mongol Empire under Genghis Khan.
The Kazakh Khanate was established, uniting Kazakh tribes.
Kazakhstan gradually came under the control of the Russian Empire.
Kazakhstan became a Soviet republic within the USSR.
Kazakhstan declared independence following the dissolution of the Soviet Union.
